intro: Cyanea megacarpa, commonly known as the giant hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy flowers that can reach up to 12 inches in diameter. The plant has broad, waxy leaves and produces fruit that is typically a capsule containing numerous seeds. It thrives in coastal areas and is adapted to the tropical climate of Hawaii. Due to its ecological and cultural significance, it is a notable species in Hawaiian botany.
